org.settings4j
Interface ObjectResolver

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractObjectResolver, JavaXMLBeansObjectResolver, ReadOnlyObjectResolverWrapper, SpringConfigObjectResolver, UnionObjectResolver
public interface ObjectResolver

The ObjectResolver is a Helper to resolce byte[] Content to a Java Object.

 Example:
 

 <connector name="ClasspathConnector" class="org.settings4j.connector.ClasspathConnector">
     <objectResolver-ref ref="JavaXMLBeansObjectResolver" />
 </connector>
 <root>
     <connector-ref ref="ClasspathConnector" />
 </root>
 <objectResolver name="JavaXMLBeansObjectResolver" class="org.settings4j.objectresolver.JavaXMLBeansObjectResolver" />
You can now store a XMLEncoded (Serialized) Java-Objects into your Classpath. see JavaXMLBeansObjectResolver for more details.

Most ObjectResolver-implementations needs a property-File for more informations, how the XML-File should be resolved.
By convention the propertyfile will be searched by the given contentResolver under key + ".properties"

Author:
hbrabenetz

Method Detail

getObject

java.lang.Object getObject(java.lang.String key,
                           ContentResolver contentResolver)
Reads the byte[] content from the ContentResolver and creates an Object. The normal usecase of an implementation of this ObjectResolver Interface:
  1. Read the Propertyfile from ContentResolver.getContent(key + ".properties")
  2. Read the Value of "objectResolverKey" from propertyfile
  3. The "objectResolverKey" defines which ObjectResolver-Implementation should solve the byte[] content to a Java-Object
  4. Convert the byte[] from ContentResolver.getContent(String key) to an Object.
  5. Maybe additional values are consumed from the propertyfile

Parameters:
key - The Key of the byte[] who should be converted to an Object.
contentResolver - The contentResolver, from where the content could be read.
Returns:
the Object, or null if this Object-Resolver can not convert the byte[] Content to an Object.

setObject

int setObject(java.lang.String key,
              ContentResolver contentResolver,
              java.lang.Object value)
Serialize and store the byte[] with the ContentResolver under the given key. The normal usecase of an implementation of this ObjectResolver Interface:
  1. Read the Propertyfile from ContentResolver.getContent(key + ".properties")
  2. Read the Value of "objectResolverKey" from propertyfile
  3. The "objectResolverKey" defines which ObjectResolver-Implementation should store the Java-Object to an Byte[]
  4. Convert the Object to a byte[] and store it with ContentResolver.setContent(String, byte[]) .
  5. Maybe additional values are consumed from the propertyfile

Parameters:
key - The Key of the byte[] the serialized Object should be stored.
contentResolver - The ContentResolver is used to store the byte[] content.
value - The new Object who should be serialized.
Returns:
Constants.SETTING_SUCCESS or Constants.SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE

addObjectResolver

void addObjectResolver(ObjectResolver objectResolver)
Some Implementations of a ObjectResolver are delegating the functionality to other ObjectResolvers.
Examples are: ReadOnlyObjectResolverWrapper or UnionObjectResolver 
 --------------------------------------
 <objectResolver name="DefaultObjectResolver" class="org.settings4j.objectresolver.UnionObjectResolver">
     <objectResolver-ref ref="JavaXMLBeansObjectResolver" />
     <objectResolver-ref ref="SpringConfigObjectResolver" />
 </objectResolver>
 --------------------------------------

Parameters:
objectResolver - the original objectResolver to delegate.

notifyContentHasChanged

void notifyContentHasChanged(java.lang.String key)
Notify the ObjectResolver-Implementation if a byte[] content is stored by some ContentResolver

This is the right place to clear cached Objects for the given key.

Parameters:
key - The key from which the Content has changed.
